docs.title: About
docs.text: This intelligent textbook teaches reading skills to kindergarten students through interactive lessons, engaging simulations, and structured learning paths.

docs.title: About This Textbook
docs.text: Reading for Kindergarten is designed to help young learners develop foundational reading skills in an engaging and interactive way.

docs.title: Author
docs.text: Dan McCreary

docs.title: Contact
docs.text: For questions or feedback about this textbook, please visit the GitHub repository.

docs.title: Course Description
docs.text: This course introduces kindergarten students to foundational reading skills.

docs.title: Target Audience
docs.text: Kindergarten students (ages 5-6)

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: None - this course is designed for beginning readers.

docs.title: Learning Outcomes
docs.text:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:

  1. Recognize letters of the alphabet
  2. Understand basic phonics
  3. Read simple words
  4. Comprehend short sentences

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Common questions about this course and reading instruction.

docs.title: General Questions
docs.text:
Q: What age is this course designed for? A: This course is designed for kindergarten students, typically ages 5-6.

Q: Do students need any prior reading knowledge? A: No, this course starts from the very beginning.

More questions will be added as the course develops.

docs.title: How to Use This Textbook
docs.text:
1. Navigate the chapters - Use the left sidebar to move through chapters in order
  2. Try the MicroSims - Interactive simulations help reinforce concepts
  3. Take the quizzes - Test your understanding after each chapter
  4. Review the glossary - Look up unfamiliar terms

docs.text:
A learning graph shows how concepts in this course relate to each other. It helps identify:
